quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Group and Album
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, punk, design. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Irish blues/rock musician recorded the album Calling Card in 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rory Gallagher

questions.question: Which British rock band, recorded the hits Bohemian Rhapsody, We Will Rock You and We Are The Champions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen

questions.question: Black Sabbath was formed in what city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birmingham

questions.question: The following lyrics are from the song Orgasm Addicts, recorded by which punk group?

options.text: t then you found out that its a habit that sticks?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buzzcocks

questions.question: This punk rock group from San Pedro, California, was disbanded after its guitarist and lead singer, Dennes Dale Boon, died in a car accident in December 1985.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minutemen

questions.question: This group had a huge hit in 1971 with One Toke Over The Line.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brewer  Shipley

questions.question: This group was asking us How Can You Mend A Broken Heart in 1971.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bee Gees

questions.question: The band was named after a horror movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: 2112, the fourth studio album by Canadian rock band Rush, was inspired by which science-fiction novella?

options.text: The Time Machine by H. G. Wells

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anthem by Ayn Rands

questions.question: Black Sabbath has never done a cover song on an album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Their guitarist had two missing fingertips.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This musician, also known as Sananda Maitreya, received a Grammy Award in 1988 for his debut solo album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terrence Trent Darby

questions.question: The founding members are Ozzy Osbourne, Tony Iommi, Geezer Butler and this man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Ward

questions.question: This group Woke up in Love This Morning in 1971.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Partridge Family

questions.question: Leo Fender got the idea for the design of his early guitars from which country singer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Merle Travis

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Musical and Song

questions.question: This rapper had a huge hit song in 1989 with Bust A Move.

questions.question: Which musical is based on Mark Twains novel The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big River

questions.question: This Broadway musical, set in pre-Nazi Austria, relates the exploits of an ex-nun who is sent out to be a governess to seven motherless children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sound of Music

questions.question: This singer went straight up the charts with the smash hit song  Straight Up .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paula Abdul

questions.question: This musical follows the life of a poor Russian milkman and his family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fiddler on the Roof

questions.question: Which musical traces the life of American composer/actor George Cohan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George M!

questions.question: This musical tells the story of a con-man salesman and a librarian from Iowa.

questions.question: This musical centers on the feud between farmers and sheep herders in the Mid West.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oklahoma

questions.question: The song Sweet Leaf is a love song to this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marijuana

questions.question: What was the original name for the group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earth

questions.question: How many studio albums were recorded by the original lineup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: This musical is set in the Alphabet City section of Manhattan and centers on people coping with AIDS.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rent

questions.question: This musical, set on the Mississippi River, tells the story of a riverboat gambler and the young innocent girl.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Show Boat

questions.question: Ozzy sings every song on all the Sabbath Albums in which he appeared.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This musical is set in Germany in 1930 and is based on the play I Am a Camera.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cabaret

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Eagles and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocals, saturday. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1981, Don Henley did a duet with 70s sensation Stevie Nicks. What was the name of the smash single that they put out together?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leather And Lace

questions.question: Who was telling us If Loving You Is Wrong, I Dont Want To Be Right?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luther Ingram

questions.question: What year did the multi-talented 70s band The Eagles officially break up?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: This singer had a huge hit in 1989 with Lost In Your Eyes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debbie Gibson

questions.question: After breaking up, The Eagles have never performed together again on stage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who sang lead vocals on The Eagles smash hit I Cant Tell You Why (1980)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Timothy B. Schmit

questions.question: In 1972, The Eagles struck gold with this song written by 70s singing sensation Jackson Browne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Take It Easy

questions.question: Which 1975 song by the popular band The Eagles was their first # 1 on the U. S charts?

options.text: The Smoker You Drink The Player You Get

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Best Of My Love

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Henley

questions.question: What guitarist from The James Gang joined The Eagles after the departure of band member Bernie Leadon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Walsh

questions.question: What group had a hit song in 1972 with Day by Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Godspell

questions.question: What year was the popular 70s band The Eagles formed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1971

questions.question: Skid Row had a big hit in 1989 with this song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 18 And Life

questions.question: The Eagles Greatest Hits has sold over 20,000,000 copies since its release in 1975.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This group was singing about Saturday in the Park in 1972.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: What was the make-up design of Kiss drummer Eric Carr?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blink 182

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brewers yeast extract

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catrine Dominique

questions.question: In 2006 the English progressive rock band Genesis consisted of 3 members only. Which ones?

options.text: Tony Banks, Phil Collins, Mike Rutherford
Peter Gabriel, Phil Collins, Tony Rutherford
John Mayhew, Phil Collins, Mike Rutherford
Peter Gabriel, Ray Wilson, Steve Hackett

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Banks, Phil Collins, Mike Rutherford

questions.question: Guitarist and keyboardist William Dean Martins first band was Overflow, but he soon joined identical twins Joel and Benji Madden in this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Good Charlotte

questions.question: What Spanish duo sang the smash hit Macarena in the summer of 1996?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Del Rio

questions.question: The second video to air on MTV at its start on August 1, 1981 belonged to which artist or group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Benatar

questions.question: Billie Joe Armstrong formed a band called Sweet Children with childhood friend, Mike Dirnt, and Al Sobrante, which was later renamed to this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Day

questions.question: Which of these women was the inspiration for Guns n Roses song Sweet Child of Mine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Erin Everly

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Members and 1990s
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, crooks, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Lesane Parish Crooks (Tupacs real name) was born to Alice Faye Williams on this date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16 June 1971

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cowboys

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jewel

questions.question: Which one of these male groups is not comprised of brothers as members?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: O-Town

questions.question: Which group did not have any of the original members in it by the time it broke up in the late 1990s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cover Girls

questions.question: Tributes to Aaliyah and Lisa Lopes can be seen in music videos of this music diva.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Missy Elliott

questions.question: Which group once referred to famous actress, Christina Applegate, in one of their hit songs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: P.M. Dawn

questions.question: Irish singer Sinead O Connor ruined her career by ripping apart a photo of the US President on Saturday Night Live in the early 1990s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gloria Estefan

questions.question: Finish this line from the first single by Marcy Playground: I smell sex and __.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: candy

questions.question: What was the trademark sign of Kriss Kross, the young rap duo of the early 1990s?

options.text: wearing big colorful hats in their videos
being dressed all in black in their videos
a Double K symbol on their shirts.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Xscape

questions.question: What is the missing word in this line from a song by The Bloodhound Gang:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: mammals

questions.question: Which one of these 1990s boy bands was the only band to have a #1 hit on the Billboard Hot 100 in the 90s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Kids on the Block

questions.question: Which one of these 1990s bands was not comprised of sisters as members?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cardigans

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Lyrics and Album
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, zeppelin, stairway. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Strictly 4 My N.I.G.G.A.Z. went gold, but not platinum.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1994 Tupac was convicted of sexually abusing a woman and in 1995 he was sentenced to jail time. What was the period of time that Tupac was sentenced to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 years and 6 months

questions.question: In 1990 Tupac joined a rap group as a roadie, dancer and occasionally as a rapper. What was the name of the group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Digital Underground

questions.question: In 1986 Tupac and his family moved to Baltimore. There, he enrolled in the Baltimore School of Arts, where he studied ballet and acting, and was really happy for a while.  In Baltimore, he also started rapping and became known under this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MC New York

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from  Led Zeppelins, Dancing Days:

options.text: ncing days are here again as the summer evenings grow
I got a star that glows
I got a woman who knows
I got a lion standing alone
I got a tadpole in a jar

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I got a woman who knows

questions.question: Tupacs solo-debut album was released in 1991. This album included songs such as Violent and Brendas Got A Baby.  Do you know the name of this album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2pacalypse Now

questions.question: Complete the lyrics of the opening track on Led Zeppelins third album, Led Zeppelin III:

options.text: drive our ships to new lands

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: drive our ships to new lands

questions.question: Lesanes name was later changed to Tupac Amaru. What does Tupac Amaru mean in Inca?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shining Serpent

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Led Zeppelin song, The Rover:

options.text: d the wind is crying, from a love that wont grow cold
on the dark side of the globe
on the dark side of the moon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: on the dark side of the globe

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from All my Love, a song recorded by Led Zeppelin in 1979:

options.text: last the arm is straight, the hand to the loom...
Is a feather in the wind.
Is this to end or just begin?
All of my love, all of my love, All of my love to you.
For me, the cloth once more to spin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Is this to end or just begin?

questions.question: Tupacs movie debut was in the movie Poetic Justice.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: There are many theories about the death of this rap legend. However, two things are certain - firstly,  he was shot on 7 September 1996 and secondly, he was pronounced dead at 4:03 PM on this date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13 September 1996

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Good Times, Bad Times, a song which appeared on Led Zeppelins debut album:

options.text: But we aint ever gonna part
I find my way into the same old jam
Ive tried to do all those things the best I can
Well, I still dont seem to care

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Well, I still dont seem to care

questions.question: In arabic Shakur means Black Prince.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Stairway to Heaven, written by Led Zeppelin vocalist, Robert Plant:

options.text: d its whispered that soon if we all call the tune
d a new day will dawn for those who stand long ...
And shes buying a stairway to heaven
And the forests will echo with laughter
Theres still time to change the road youre on

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: And the forests will echo with laughter
